meanings.sent1: The car was passing the slow truck on the highway.
meanings.sent2: I saw a bird passing by my window this morning.
meanings.sent3: The turtle thought it was passing a race car.
meanings.sent4: Time keeps passing like a river flowing downstream.
meanings.sent5: The runner was passing all the other competitors effortlessly.

meanings.definition: Going by or beyond a place
meanings.sent1: The train went passing through the tunnel with a loud noise.
meanings.sent2: I walked passing the park on my way to school.
meanings.sent3: The cat went passing the dog, surprising everyone.
meanings.sent4: The days kept going passing quickly, like a blur.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed passing the old mill, carrying memories away.

meanings.sent1: The passing storm left behind a rainbow in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The passing cars created a lot of noise on the street.
meanings.sent3: The passing moment felt like a dream within a dream.
meanings.sent4: The passing day whispered secrets of the night to come.
meanings.sent5: The passing seasons painted the trees in different colors.

meanings.sent1: The passing train could be heard from a distance.
meanings.sent2: The passing clouds signaled an incoming storm.
meanings.sent3: The passing hourglass reminded her of time slipping away.
meanings.sent4: The passing footsteps grew louder as they neared the door.
meanings.sent5: The passing shadows on the wall indicated the sun was setting.

meanings.definition: Succeeding in a test or examination
meanings.sent1: After studying hard, she felt confident about passing the exam.
meanings.sent2: He was relieved to hear that he was passing all his classes.
meanings.sent3: The passing grade brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: Passing the test felt like a weight lifted off his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: She celebrated passing the challenging test with her friends.
